1.verse_text: Jerusalem once was a city full of people, but now the city is so empty. but now she is like a poor widow. She was once a princess among cities, but now she has been made a slave. Her tears are on her cheeks. She has no one to comfort her. Many nations were friendly to her, but not one of them comforts her now. All her friends have turned their backs on her and have become her enemies. and then she was taken into captivity. She lives among other nations but has found no rest. The people who chased her caught her because no one comes to Zion for the festivals anymore. All of Zion"s gates have been destroyed; all her priests groan in sorrow. and all this made Zion sad. Her enemies have been successful. This happened because the Lord punished her. He punished Jerusalem for her many sins. Her children have gone away. Their enemies captured them and took them away. Her princes were like deer that cannot find a meadow to feed in. They walk away without strength from those who chased them. She remembers the time when she was hurt and when she lost her home. She remembers all the nice things that she had in the past. She remembers those nice things that she had in the old days. She remembers when her people were captured by the enemy. She remembers when there was no one to help her. When her enemies saw her, they laughed, because she was destroyed. Because Jerusalem sinned, she became a ruined city that people shake their heads about. In the past people respected her. But now they hate her, because they abused her. Jerusalem groaned and turned away. She gave no thought to what would become of her. Her fall was amazing. She had no one to comfort her. She says, 'Lord, see how I am hurt! See how my enemy thinks he is so great!' He took all her nice things. In fact, she saw the foreign nations go inside her Temple. And you said those people could not join in our assembly! All of her people are looking for food. They are giving away all their nice things for food to stay alive. Jerusalem says, 'Look, Lord. Look at me! See how people hate me. But look at me and see. Is there any pain like my pain? Is there any pain like the pain that has come to me? Is there any pain like the pain that the Lord has punished me with? He has punished me on the day of his great anger. that went down into my bones. He stretched out a net for my feet. He turned me all the way around. He made me into a wasteland. I am sick all day. My sins were tied up in the Lord"s hands. His yoke is on my neck. He has made me weak. He has given me to those who I cannot stand up against. who were inside the city. Then he brought a group of people against me. He brought them to kill my young soldiers. like grapes in a winepress. Tears are flowing down my cheeks. There is no one near to comfort me. There is no one who can make me feel better. My children are like a wasteland, because the enemy won.' There was no one to comfort her. The Lord had given orders to Jacob"s enemies. He ordered them to surround the city. Jerusalem has become a dirty rag that her enemies threw away. so he is right for doing these things. So listen, all you people! Look at my pain! My young women and men have gone into captivity. but they tricked me. My priests and my elders have died in the city. They were looking for food for themselves. They wanted to keep themselves alive. I am upset, as if my heart turned upside down inside of me. I feel this way because I have been so stubborn. Out in the streets, I lost my children to the swords. Inside, it is like death. I have no one to comfort me. All my enemies have heard of my trouble. They are happy that you did this to me. You said there would be a time of punishment. You said you would punish my enemies. Now do what you said. Let my enemies be like I am now. Then you can treat them the same way you treated me because of all my sins. Do this because I am groaning again and again. Do this because my heart is sick.' She was one of the greatest cities in the world, where there was no way out. Zion"s young women have been taken away, The Lord has trampled his dearest city
She cries bitterly in the night.

The roads to Zion are very sad,

The beauty of Daughter Zion has gone away.
Jerusalem thinks back.
Jerusalem sinned very badly.
Jerusalem"s skirts were dirty.

2.verse_text: Look how the Lord has covered daughter Zion with the cloud of his anger. He has thrown her, the glory of Israel, from the sky to the ground. In his anger he showed no care even for the Temple He destroyed them without mercy. In his anger he destroyed the fortresses of Daughter Judah. He threw the kingdom of Judah and its rulers to the ground. He ruined the kingdom of Judah. all the strength of Israel. He took away his right hand from Israel. He did this when the enemy came. He burned like a flaming fire in Jacob. He was like a fire that burns all around. He held his sword in his right hand. He killed all the good-looking men of Judah. He killed them as if they were the enemy. He poured out his anger like a fire on the tents of Zion. He has swallowed up Israel. He has swallowed up all her palaces and all her fortresses. He has made much sadness and crying for the dead in Daughter Judah. as if it were a garden. He has ruined the place where the people came together to worship him. The Lord has made people forget He rejected the king and the priests. He was angry and rejected them. and he left his holy place of worship. He let the enemy pull down the walls of the palaces of Jerusalem. The enemy shouted with joy in the Lord"s Temple. They made noise as though it were a festival. the wall of Daughter Zion. He marked the wall with a measuring line. He didn"t stop himself from destroying it. He made all the walls cry out in sadness. Together they wasted away. The bars on her gates are completely destroyed. Her king and princes have been taken to other nations. The teaching of the law has stopped. And her prophets no longer receive visions from the Lord. They sit on the ground and are quiet. They pour dust on their heads. They put on sackcloth. The young women of Jerusalem bow their heads to the ground in sorrow. and my insides are upset. My heart feels like it has been poured on the ground; I feel this way because of the destruction of my people. Children and babies are fainting in the public squares of the city. 'Where is the bread and wine?' as they pour out their life in their mother"s laps. What can I compare you to? What can I say you are like? How can I comfort you, city of Zion? You have been hurt much too badly for anyone to heal. but their visions were only worthless lies. They didn"t speak against your sins. They didn"t try to make things better. They spoke messages for you, but they were false messages that fooled you. clap their hands and laugh at you. They make fun of Jerusalem, shaking their heads at the sight of her. They ask, 'Is this the city that people called "The Most Beautiful City" and "The Joy of all the Earth"?' They whistle and grind their teeth at you. They say, 'We have swallowed them up! This is the day we were hoping for. We have finally seen this happen!' He did what he said he would do. He did what he commanded a long time ago. He destroyed, and he had no pity. He made your enemies happy because of what happened to you. He made your enemies strong. Jerusalem, let tears roll down your walls. Let your tears flow like a stream day and night. Don"t stop crying or let your eyes dry. Let your sorrow pour out before the Lord like water. Lift up your hands in prayer to him. Ask him to let your children live. They are starving to death on every street corner. Have you ever treated anyone else so badly? Is it right for women to eat their own babies, the children they have cared for? Should priests and prophets be killed in the Temple of the Lord? lie on the ground in the streets of the city. My young women and young men have been killed by the sword. You killed them on the day of your anger. You killed them without mercy! You invited terror as though you were inviting it to a festival. No one escaped on the day of the Lord"s anger. My enemy killed the people who I raised and brought up. where he rests his feet. the special assemblies and special days of rest in Zion.

He surrounded me with bitterness and trouble. like someone who died long ago. He put heavy chains on me. he does not listen to my prayer. He has made my path crooked. like a lion that is in a hiding place. He tore me to pieces and ruined me. He made me the target for his arrows. with his arrows. All day long they sing songs about me and make fun of me. He filled me with this bitter drink. He pushed me into the dirt. I forgot about good things. that the Lord will help me.' and I have no home. Remember the bitter poison that you gave me. and I am very sad. and I have hope: the Lord"s faithful love never ends. You are so very true and loyal! He is good to those who look for him. for the Lord to save them. from the time he is young. when the Lord puts his yoke on him. Maybe there is still hope. and let people insult him. the Lord does not reject people forever. He has mercy because of his great love and kindness. He does not like to make anyone unhappy. to be trampled down. Some people will do such things right in front of God Most High. He does not like any of these things. unless the Lord orders it. both good and bad things to happen. when he punishes them for their sins. Then let us turn back to the Lord. to the God of heaven. 5.verse_text: Remember, Lord, what happened to us. Look and see our shame. Our houses have been given to foreigners. We have no father. Our mothers have become like widows. We have to pay for the wood that we use. We get tired, and we have no rest. We also made an agreement with Assyria to get enough bread. And we are suffering because of their sins. No one can save us from them. There are men in the desert with swords. We have a high fever because of our hunger. They raped the women in the cities of Judah. They didn"t honor our elders. Our young men stumbled under loads of wood. The young men no longer make music. Our dancing has changed to crying for the dead. Things have gone bad for us because we sinned. and our eyes cannot see clearly. Foxes run around on Mount Zion. Your kingly chair lasts forever and ever. You seem to have left us alone for such a long time. We will gladly come back to you. Make our lives as they were before. Have you completely rejected us?
Our land has been turned over to strangers.
We have become orphans.
We have to buy the water that we drink.
We are forced to wear a yoke on our necks.
We made an agreement with Egypt.
Our ancestors sinned against you, and now they are dead.
Slaves have become our rulers.
We risk our lives to get food.
Our skin is hot like an oven.
The enemy raped the women of Zion.
The enemy hanged our princes.
The enemy made our young men grind grain at the mill.
The elders no longer sit at the gates of the city.
We have no more joy in our hearts.
The crown has fallen from our head.
For this reason, our hearts have become sick,
Mount Zion is a wasteland.
But you rule forever, Lord.
You seem to have forgotten us forever.
Bring us back to you, Lord.
You were very angry with us.
